'''Wingull''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''キャモメ''' ''Camome'') is a dual-type {{2t|Water|Flying}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation III]].

It [[Evolution|evolve]]s into {{p|Pelipper}} starting at [[level]] 25.

==Biology==
Wingull is a small, white Pokémon similar to a seagull. Its head makes up a large portion of its body, as it appears to lack a neck. It has thin, simplistic eyes, two triangular tufts on top its head, and an orange beak with a hooked, black tip. Three blue-tipped feathers give it a fan-like tail. Its small, orange feet have two webbed toes. Wingull has long, flat wings with light blue stripes near the tips. By extending its wings, it is able to catch updrafts and glide across the sky. 

It builds its nests on {{DL|List of Pokémon by habitat|Sea Pokémon|steep cliffs by the sea,}} and habitually hides prey and valuables in various locations using its beak. In [[Alola]], Wingull's main predator is {{p|Talonflame}}, which attacks and catches them with powerful kicks. It circles above oceans looking for its favorite food - {{p|Wishiwashi}} - to eat. Fishermen use this skill to locate areas teeming with fish Pokémon. It also loves to eat {{p|Finneon}} who jump up on the sea surface.

==In the anime==
===In the main series===
[[File:Wingull anime.png|thumb|250px|Wingull in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
====Major appearances====
=====[[Peeko]]=====
[[Mr. Briney]]'s Wingull, [[Peeko]], first appeared in ''[[AG018|On a Wingull and a Prayer!]]''.

=====Other=====
A Wingull appeared in ''[[AG056|Poetry Commotion!]]'', under the ownership of [[Mr. Moore]]. Wingull was used to pop a hole in Team Rocket's balloon as they attempted to escape with [[Flannery]]'s {{p|Torkoal}}.

[[Holly]] owns a Wingull, which she used in the [[Hearthome City Tag Battle Competition]] in ''[[DP050|Tag! We're It...!]]''. It battled with [[Brock's Sudowoodo]] against a {{p|Bagon}} and a {{p|Yanma}}. With the help of advice from {{an|Brock}}, they eventually won the match.

====Minor appearances====
A Wingull appeared in ''[[EP274|Hoenn Alone!]]'', where it was seen flying above the ship which took {{Ash}} to [[Hoenn]].

Multiple Wingull appeared in ''[[AG027|A Three Team Scheme!]]'', one of which pecks [[Professor Birch]] for disturbing its nest.

Multiple Wingull appeared in ''[[AG032|Abandon Ship!]]''.

A {{pkmn|Coordinator}}'s Wingull appeared in ''[[AG035|Win, Lose, or Drew!]]'', where it was participating in the {{ci|Slateport}} {{pkmn|Contest}}.

Two Wingull appeared in the ending credits of ''[[M06|Jirachi: Wish Maker]]''.

Multiple Wingull appeared in ''[[M07|Destiny Deoxys]]'' and ''[[M09|Pokémon Ranger and the Temple of the Sea]]''.

A Wingull appeared in ''[[AG080|That's Just Swellow]]'', where it was used in the [[Crossgate Town]] [[PokéRinger]]. It competed against a {{p|Yanma}}, {{p|Swablu}}, and a {{p|Pelipper}}

[[Juan]] has a Wingull that appeared in ''[[AG110|The Great Eight Fate!]]''.

Multiple Wingull appeared in ''[[M17|Diancie and the Cocoon of Destruction]]''.

===In Pokémon Generations===
[[File:Wingull PG.png|thumb|250px|Wingull in [[Pokémon Generations]]]]
Multiple wild Wingull appeared in ''[[PG08|The Cavern]]'', where they were seen flying near the [[Mossdeep Space Center]] and around the waters above the [[Seafloor Cavern]]. They were some of the many Pokémon caught up in [[Primal Reversion|Primal]] {{p|Kyogre}}'s rampage.

==In the manga==
[[File:Peeko Adventures.png|thumb|110px|Wingull in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
{{main|Peeko}}
Wingull first appeared in ''[[PS190| Blowing Past Nosepass I]]'' in the form of [[Peeko]], [[Mr. Briney]]'s pet bird. She eventually evolved into a Pelipper by the time of the {{DL|FireRed & LeafGreen chapter (Adventures)|next chapter}}.

A Wingull appeared in ''[[PS365|Crafty Carnivine]]''.

In ''[[PS383|Winning Over Wingull]]'', {{adv|Pearl}} fights a pack of Wingull on his way to [[Lake Valor]]. They continually switched out the weakened and healed themselves with {{m|Roost}}, but their hostility vanished when Pearl helped save their young from falling.

A Trainer's Wingull appeared in ''[[PS421|Clobbering Claydol]]'' and [[PASM04]].

In ''[[PS435|The Final Dimensional Duel V]]'', a Wingull appeared on [[Fullmoon Island]] in {{FB|Tower Tycoon|Palmer}}'s flashback.

Two Wingull appeared in ''[[PS525|The Transfer Student]]''.

Multiple wild Wingull appeared in the {{chap|Sun & Moon}}.

A Wingull appeared in the {{chap|Sun & Moon}} inside the [[Aether Paradise]].

==Trivia==
* Wingull is one of fourteen Pokémon that one could collect [[foreign Pokédex entries]] for in {{game|Diamond and Pearl|s}}.
* Wingull has the exact same base stats as {{p|Taillow}} with only their Attack and Special Attack swapped.

===Origin===
Wingull appears to be based on a {{wp|gull}}, but its method of floating on air currents more closely resembles an {{wp|albatross}}.

====Name origin====
Wingull is a combination of ''wing'' and ''{{wp|gull}}''.

Camome is a corruption of カモメ ''kamome'' (gull).
